question: A business analyst is ensuring that the requirements and designs have been defined correctly and provide the necessary information. What task is the BA performing?

options.B: Perform quality assurance

question: In what task are requirements allocated to a solution component or a release?

options.A: Analyze potential value and recommend solution
options.B: Specify and model requirements

question: Which of the following statements is true about the focus group technique?

options.A: It is a form of quantitative research.
options.B: A form of a systematic group interview to create formal requirements.
options.D: Results of focus groups are direct inputs to functional decomposition.

question: A business analyst is preparing to conduct a workshop and wants to elicit numerous, creative ideas from the participants. Which technique would be the best to use?

options.B: Focus group

question: Which type of stakeholder is an organizational change consultant and a trainer?

options.B: Implementation subject matter experts

question: A business analyst decided to administer a survey to stakeholder groups in person vs. email. What is the most likely rationale for this decision?

options.A: The BA could also elicit requirements informally while he was there.
options.B: The BA didn't want to rely on statistical sampling.
options.C: The BA wanted to be present in case the respondents had questions about the survey items.
options.D: The BA wanted to bolster the response rates.

question: Which techniques can be used to attain approvals of the requirements?

options.B: Interviews and prototyping
options.C: Acceptance and evaluation criteria and decision analysis
options.D: Requirements and design modeling is the only technique required

question: How would the core concept of "change" be applied by a business analyst when working within requirements life cycle management?

options.A: By managing how proposed changes to requirements and designs are evaluated during an initiative.
options.B: By determining how changes to business analysis results will be requested and authorized.
options.C: By using a variety of elicitation techniques to fully identify the characteristics of a change.
options.D: By transforming elicitation results into requirements and designs.

question: Which of the listed techniques is used to ensure coverage of activities by denoting responsibility, identifying roles, discovering missing roles, and communicating results of a planned change?

options.B: Stakeholder list, map, or personas

question: Requirements traceability identifies and documents the lineage of each requirement. What are the ways in which this lineage can be identified and documented?

options.A: Downwards, upwards, and the relationships between requirements
options.B: Downwards, upwards, and relationships between designs
options.C: Backwards, forwards, and the relationships between requirements
options.D: Backwards, forwards, and the relationships between risks

question: Solution requirements can be divided into which two sub-categories?

options.B: Solution requirements do not have sub-categories

question: Which of the following tasks are included in the requirements life cycle management knowledge area?

options.A: Trace requirements, analyze requirements, assess requirement changes, and approve requirement changes.
options.B: Review project scope, determine stakeholder requirements, and approve requirements.
options.C: Stakeholder requirements reviews, requirements design, requirements traceability, requirements prioritization, and requirements design walk-throughs.
options.D: Trace requirements, approve requirements, prioritize requirements, assess requirement changes, and maintain requirements.

question: "Atomic" is a characteristic of requirements and design quality. What does it mean?

options.A: It is at the level that will guide further work.
options.B: It contains no extraneous or unnecessary content.
options.C: It is self-contained and capable of being understood independently of other requirements or designs.

question: A business analyst distributes a set of questions to stakeholders to elicit requirements, whose responses are then collected, summarized, and analyzed. Which elicitation technique is the business analyst using?

options.B: Survey or questionnaire

question: A business analyst is evaluating an organization in support of a new initiative. What tool could the BA use to facilitate the evaluation?

options.B: SWOT analysis

question: Which of the following describes the purpose and direction for the change request, establishes the context for it, and identifies the critical components of the request?

options.B: Business case

question: How is the technique of stakeholder list, map, or persona used in the manage stakeholder collaboration task?

options.A: This technique is not utilized in the manage stakeholder collaboration task.
options.B: Shows the informal relationships between stakeholders.
options.C: Determines who should be consulted while preparing for elicitation.
options.D: Determines the appropriate roles for each stakeholder.

question: What kind of diagram models the logic of usage scenarios by showing the information passed between objects in the system?

options.B: Sequence diagram

question: Which of the following are ways that business analysts collaborate with other stakeholders to effectively address or "treat" risks?

options.A: Removing the source of the risk, mitigating the consequences.
options.B: Mitigating the consequences, developing a contingency plan.
options.C: Avoiding the risk, developing a contingency plan.
options.D: Removing the source of the risk, developing a contingency plan.

question: Who would be the most likely audience for a survey?

options.B: Business domain SMEs
options.D: Customer, end users, implementation subject matter experts

question: The six knowledge areas within the BABOK describe â€¦

options.A: Discrete pieces of work that may be performed formally or informally as part of business analysis.
options.B: The practice of business analysis as it is applied within the boundaries of a project or throughout enterprise evolution and continuous improvement.
options.C: The support of delivering business value before, during, and after the life cycle of a project.
options.D: The resources that are required to transform an input into an output.

question: A business analyst is working closely with the project manager to evaluate the implication of proposed requirements and design changes to the project. Which task describes this evaluation?

options.B: Prioritize requirements

question: Which of the following techniques would be best suited to identify how to evaluate the quality of the requirements?

options.B: Verify requirements

question: How is a glossary different than a data dictionary?

options.A: They are the same and can be used interchangeably depending upon the organization's culture.
options.B: A glossary defines key terms relevant to the business domain while a data dictionary standardizes a definition of a data element.
options.C: They both define key terms relevant to the solution.
options.D: A glossary defines all terms used within an initiative while a data dictionary defines only terms relevant to data modeling.

question: A business analyst is documenting a use case describing an actor ordering a product from the website that is unfortunately out of stock so the actor needs to deviate from their plan. What is the business analyst documenting within the use case?

options.B: Post conditions
options.C: The narrative between the actor and the system

question: How would the core concept of "stakeholder" be applied by a business analyst when working within requirements analysis and design definition knowledge area?

options.A: By grouping stakeholders based on their relationship to the needs, changes, and solutions.
options.B: By tailoring the requirements and designs so that they are understandable and usable by each stakeholder group.
options.C: By working closely with key stakeholders to maintain understanding, agreement, and approval of requirements and designs.
options.D: By eliciting information from the stakeholders about solution performance and value delivery.

question: A senior business analyst was providing advice to a new business analyst and recommended using a matrix for their requirements modeling format. What is the purpose of this type of format?

options.A: To convey a set of requirements that have a complex but uniform structure that can be broken down.
options.B: To provide an easy way for the business analyst to model the requirements.
options.C: To clearly describe the requirements in an active voice.
options.D: To create a visual representation of the set of requirements.

question: The project team is in the process of measuring their artifacts' compliance with organizational business analysis performance standards. What tool would help in carrying out these activities?

options.B: Checklist

question: Which statement best defines the business analyst's role in conflict and issues management?

options.A: The business analyst records all approval decisions in a requirements management or tracking tool.
options.B: The business analyst determines how to secure decisions and resolve conflicts across an initiative.
options.C: The business analyst ensures that the stakeholders with approval authority understand and accept the requirements.
options.D: The business analyst obtains stakeholder approvals and is required to understand who holds decision-making responsibility and who possesses authority for sign-off across the initiative.

question: When does the task of manage stakeholder collaboration begin?

options.B: Once stakeholders have been identified and analyzed.
options.D: Whenever it would add value to business analysis activities.

question: Which of the following tasks provides stakeholders with the information they need, when they need it?

options.B: Confirm elicitation results

question: Which stakeholders participate in confirming elicitation results?

options.B: Stakeholders with enough authority to approve requirements
options.C: Stakeholders who have participated in elicitation tasks

question: A business analyst is ready to elicit requirements but the domain subject matter experts (SMEs) will not be available for a couple of weeks. Which technique below would jumpstart the elicitation process without SMEs?

options.B: Workshops

question: What does verbal communication include?

options.A: Active listening, spoken words, and documentation of key points.
options.B: Active listening, psychological, and non-verbal cues.
options.C: Spoken words, tone of voice, and non-verbal cues.

question: Which technique would help a business analyst categorize stakeholders by the activities performed within their business processes?

options.B: Brainstorming

question: The purpose of tracing requirements is best described by which of the following?

options.A: Traceability requirements supplement business requirements and functional requirements.
options.B: Ensuring that requirements and designs at different levels are aligned to one another, and to manage the effects of change to one level on related requirements.
options.C: Traceability metrics are used by the Change Management Board to approve or deny requests for change.
options.D: Traceability assists in managing accountability for requirements activities that are performed by stakeholders outside of the requirements team.

question: Define design options is a task in which of the following knowledge areas?

options.B: Solution evaluation

question: What technique could a business analyst use to communicate non-linear thoughts to the project team?

options.B: Presentation

question: A business analyst is reviewing requirements with their sponsor and customer to ensure they are aligned with business and project objectives. What task is the BA performing?

options.B: Verify requirements

question: A business analyst is discovering that stakeholders use many acronyms and terms that hold different meanings for different stakeholders. For consistency, what technique can be used to ensure common understanding of terms?

options.B: Data dictionary

question: A business analyst is conducting a workshop to come up with ideas on how to solve the issue of delays in the billing process. Which one of the following would be a suggested starting point?

options.A: Draw a diagram of the process.
options.B: Identify potential root causes for the delays.

question: What is the purpose of prioritizing requirements?

options.A: To determine which requirements should be completed first.
options.B: To determine which requirements carry the most risk.
options.C: To rank requirements in the order of relative importance.
options.D: To ensure requirements align to one another and manage the effects of any proposed change.

question: What is the purpose of item tracking when verifying requirements?

options.A: Ensure that appropriate checklists are used to resolve the issues or problems by the planned date.
options.B: Ensure that problems and issues identified during verification are managed and resolved.
options.C: Ensure that problems or issues identified during verification are escalated to the project manager to track resolution.
options.D: Ensure that problems identified are reported to the help desk.

question: The business analyst is allocating requirements to specific solution components and releases that will implement them. Requirements allocation is an element of which task?

options.B: Define design options

question: Who in an organization would be most interested in reusable requirements and why?

options.A: Other business analysts or stakeholders may be interested because future projects may utilize and extend any reusable requirements.
options.B: Project managers who will be able to complete projects faster in the future if they could utilize and extend any reusable requirements.
options.C: Sponsors because future projects would be less expensive if requirements could be reused.
options.D: Implementation SMEs because they will be able to reference the ongoing requirements on the job.

question: You were selected as the business analyst for the project because of your existing expertise for the selected software package and the need to implement within an aggressive timeline. This is an example of what underlying competency?

options.B: Personal accountability

question: Why is it important to hold a lessons learned session?

options.A: To identify stakeholders and their influences in order to manage them.
options.B: To compile and document successes, opportunities for improvement, failures, and recommendations for improving the performance of future projects.
options.C: To provide input to team members' performance reviews.

question: Which of the following data models is typically used by implementation subject matter experts to describe how a database is physically organized?

options.B: Multi-variable data model

question: When can a requirement be prioritized?

options.A: At any time in its life cycle.
options.B: Only during the prioritization of requirements workshop.
options.C: Only if documented constraints and assumptions require it to be prioritized.

question: Which list describes the complete set of tasks in the requirements analysis and design definition knowledge area?

options.A: Prioritize requirements, specify and model requirements, verify requirements, validate requirements, define design options, analyze potential value and recommend solution.
options.B: Specify and model requirements, verify requirements, validate requirements, define design options, analyze potential value and recommend solution.
options.C: Specify and model requirements, verify requirements, validate requirements, define requirements architecture, assess risks, analyze potential value and recommend solution.
options.D: Specify and model requirements, verify requirements, validate requirements, define requirements architecture, define design options, analyze potential value and recommend solution.
